New Records: Virat Kohli needs 28 runs to break Mahela Jayawardene's record for the most runs in T20 World Cups.
Key Match Events: South Africa won by 5 wickets with 2 balls remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: India and South Africa were in a tussle for Group 2's top spot.
Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage.
Virat Kohli was on the verge of a T20 World Cup record.
South Africa's strategy included picking an extra pacer in Perth.
India had the better of South Africa in previous tournaments and outplayed them in a series just before this one.
South Africa's intent was to go hard and bat big.
India's batting performance against Pakistan was a statement-win.
India followed up with a clinical performance against Netherlands.
South Africa needed to play catch-up to ensure they make the knockouts.
India wanted to maximize their slim advantage with a win over South Africa.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in Perth offered pace, bounce, and early swing.
The average first innings score at the venue is 143.
India and South Africa have met five times in T20 World Cups, with India winning four of those matches.
South Africa were the last team to beat India in a dead rubber in their three-match series earlier this month.
